Cardiologist reveals surprising cause of heart failure; not high BP or clogged arteries
description: Cardiologist Dmitry Yaranov highlights amyloidosis as an underdiagnosed cause of heart failure, often mistaken for hypertension or aging. This condition involves misfolded proteins stiffening the heart, making it difficult to pump blood effectively. Symptoms mimic common heart issues, leading to years of misdiagnosis, yet early detection is vital for patient outcomes.

NCRB: West Bengal's jails house the most foreigners
description: Bengal houses the highest number of foreign prisoners in India, with 2,508 inmates, primarily Bangladeshis detained for illegal entry. These foreigners constitute 9% of the state's total prison population, contributing to severe overcrowding at 120% occupancy. Low deportation rates and a large shared border exacerbate the issue, with many being undertrials.

title: What is Nagaland’s job quota issue? | Explained
description: Why is the government relooking its jobs policy? Why are the tribes in the State divided on the policy?

title: Hope speaks a universal language; fight for dignity, democracy same: Rahul in Colombia
description: Artists who use colour as resistance, and students who dream fearlessly inspire me, Rahul Gandhi said

title: Love story that began with a wrong number ended in murder
description: A wrong number call blossomed into a secret affair, culminating in the murder of 30-year-old Sonam in Hardoi two years ago. Sonam, who pressured her married lover Maseedul to marry her, was killed by him, his brother, and father on August 8, 2023. Her skeleton was recovered from a well after two arrests, with Maseedul currently on the run.

title: 6-year-old dies at Jaipur hospital; parents claim boy was given cough syrup at home in Churu
description: The child was suffering from acute brain fever

title: Two killed in septic tank blast at Farrukhabad coaching centre
Why is a spectre of empty classrooms looming? | Explained
description: What has the Supreme Court ruled on the Teachers’ Eligibility Test? How many teachers are likely to be affected? Why has Tamil Nadu sought a review? What does Article 21A lay down? What is the situation in other States? Are minority institutions part of the verdict?

title: Controversy over remarks on Balasaheb Thackeray’s death, Shiv Sena UBT to file defamation case
description: Sena UBT leader Anil Parab said that the claims made by Ramdas Kadam were a figment of imagination and were made to divert attention from the issues being faced by Maharashtra

title: Allahabad High Court refuse interim protection to Sambhal’s Rayan Buzurg Mosque from demolition
description: The mosque management, in its plea, had claimed that the notices issued were in ‘gross violation’ of the Supreme Court’s directions issued last year which mandated adherence to due process before demolition of religious structures

title: Cough syrup tragedy: MP bans Coldrif as kids' death toll rises to 11
description: Eleven children died in MP's Chhindwara from renal failure after consuming cough syrup. A lab report confirmed Coldrif syrup contained 48.6% diethylene glycol, a poisonous industrial chemical. This prompted MP to ban the medicine and other products from its manufacturer, Sresan Pharmaceuticals, while multi-state checks on drug units are now underway.

title: Supreme Court to hear Wangchuk’s wife’s plea on October 6
description: Dr. Gitanjali J. Angmo has asked the apex court to direct the authorities to produce Wangchuk in court

title: Minister Vishwakarma is new Gujarat BJP chief
How is India responding to crowding disasters? | Explained
description: Why did things get out of hand at actor Vijay’s political rally in Tamil Nadu? What are the crowd control protocols in place? Are these measures statutory? Where have the most enforceable initiatives emerged? Should responsibility of managing crowds be fixed on organisers?

title: Ingesting the wrong variety
description: While there is much debate on malnutrition among the poor with many going without a proper square meal a day, even those who can afford food are not eating the right food

title: Nirav Modi case: India may give 'no arrest' pledge to get him extradited
description: Indian agencies will assure a UK court that no new cases will be filed against fugitive Nirav Modi if he is extradited, and he won't face fresh arrests or interrogations beyond existing charges. This submission aims to counter Modi's appeal to reopen his extradition trial, which the UK High Court previously approved. The hearing is set for November 23.

title: Outrage on campus as DU shares video link of V-C speech on ‘Urban Naxalism’ via e-mail
MCD steps up efforts after incidents of dog bite at JLN Stadium
description: Two permanent dog-catching teams stationed at venue; garbage around the stadium attracts strays: MCD official; still in fear, says attacked coach

title: Tony Blair | A man of many wars
description: The former British Prime Minister, who implemented the Blair Doctrine of ‘humanitarian interventionism’ by sending British troops to Kosovo in 1999 and to Sierra Leone, and earned public opprobrium for cheerleading the 2003 Iraq war, is set to play a key role in governing Gaza

title: Sir Creek | A marshland of contention
description: The 96-km-long estuary that lies between Kutch and Pakistan’s Sindh is of enormous economic importance, and became a flashpoint following Pakistan’s May 8 strikes against India

title: Bruins’ Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers’ 6-foot-9 Matt Rempe without fear
description: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: CM, PWD Minister take boat ride to review Chhath Puja preparations
Rajasthan Congress leader Rameshwar Dudi passes away at 62
Paddy coverage in Cauvery delta during current Samba season lower than last year
description: The farmers and officials attribute a number of reasons for this fall, with the main one being the late sowing during the short-term Kuruvai season thanks to the unseasonal spell of rain in February-April this year

title: JNUSU elections likely in November; grievance redressal cell constituted
'Forwarding pro-Pak message not sedition': Allahabad high court grants bail to man
description: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a Meerut man, Sajid Chaudhary, accused of sharing a "Pakistan zindabad" post. The court observed that merely supporting another country does not constitute endangering India's sovereignty under BNS section 152, though it might fall under promoting enmity. Sajid was charged under BNS section 152 and had been incarcerated since May.

title: Sonam Wangchuk | Ladakh’s engineer of change
description: The education reformer, roped in by Ladakh’s civil society groups to represent their causes, has been arrested under the National Security Act

'Went to build better future': How 'robbery attempt' claimed Indian student's life in US
description: A 28-year-old Hyderabad student, Pole Chandrasekhar, was fatally shot in Texas, US, on October 3 during a suspected armed robbery at his part-time gas station job. Chandrasekhar, who was pursuing a master's, died on the spot. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy expressed condolences and assured government support to repatriate his remains, with coordination underway with Indian officials.

title: Political rallies and tragedy: from the pages of a novella
description: Vazhga Vazhga, authored by Sahitya Akademi award winner Imayam, is about a crowd that gathers at the election rally of a female politician and the chaos that ensues

description: Stating that his govt., with the people’s support, revived T.N. after 10 years of misrule by the AIADMK, Stalin says only the DMK-led front has the ideological clarity to take on the NDA

title: ‘You’ve left it in a better place than what it was when you started’: Dinesh Karthik’s touching tribute to Rohit Sharma
Gurgaon horror: Invited by friend for party, teacher gang-raped by 4 men; all arrested
description: A 29-year-old foreign languages teacher in Gurgaon has accused four gym trainers of sexual assault and gang rape. The victim met one suspect, Gaurav, at a party, later agreeing to meet him on October 1. At a friend's address, Gaurav allegedly assaulted her, then called three others who also raped her. Police arrested all four suspects, now in judicial custody.

title: Ernakulam tops in domestic tourist arrivals post-COVID
description: Over 1.19 crore domestic tourists visited the State in the first six months of 2025, marking a 10.50% increase compared to the previous year

title: Fatima Sana ahead of IND vs PAK at World Cup: ‘Whatever records exist between India and Pakistan are meant to be broken’
When a ‘fellow traveller’ went to space
description: The successful launch of Sputnik — the world’s first artificial satellite to orbit Earth — on October 4, 1957 rocketed humanity to a hitherto unknown time and space. While the scientific aspects of the success were significant and groundbreaking, it also marked the beginning of the space race between the Cold War foes the Soviet Union and the U.S. A.S.Ganesh takes you back to where it all started…

Poisoning charges emerge in Zubeen Garg death case
description: The probe into Zubeen Garg’s death has dramatically escalated with fresh poisoning allegations now central to the inquiry. The SIT arrested manager Siddharth Sharma, citing a co-accused's claim that Zubeen was poisoned in Singapore by Sharma and Shyamkanu. A judicial commission has also launched its independent probe, with the CM awaiting the viscera report for truth.

description: Bihar's NDA allies, BJP and JD(U), have differing views on the upcoming assembly election schedule. BJP and several parties urged the Election Commission for a maximum of two phases to reduce costs, while JD(U) proposed a single phase, citing good law and order and potential Chhath festival voter participation. The EC is reviewing preparations in Patna.

How much alcohol is safe to drink? Experts explain the permissible daily limit
description: Alcohol has long been a part of social and cultural life, but the question of how much is truly safe remains complex. Science shows that alcohol has a biphasic effect — small amounts may offer some cardiovascular benefits, while higher intakes, even occasional, can harm the heart, liver, brain, and overall health. Individual factors like genetics, sex, and metabolism influence how the body processes alcohol, making “safe” levels vary from person to person.

Cancer alert: Oral microbes linked to pancreatic cancer risk, warn experts
description: A groundbreaking study reveals a surprising link between oral microbes and pancreatic cancer risk. Researchers found certain bacteria and fungi, including those causing gum disease, significantly raise the likelihood of developing this deadly "silent killer." This discovery offers new avenues for early detection through oral microbiome profiling and prevention strategies, urging further research into causation.

World Teachers’ Day 2025: Why it is observed on Oct 5 — theme, history and significance
New Bruce, new Alfred, new Gordon, new Gotham: Still Batman AF
Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt questions wellness after Austin health experience
description: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently experienced an "eye-opening" holistic wellness assessment at Medici Health, Austin. This comprehensive check-up, spanning heart screenings to vision tests, profoundly highlighted the critical importance of proactive self-care before health issues emerge. Hunt lauded the compassionate team and the Phillips family's vision, advocating for health as a continuous, empowering journey for all.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s one-word reply on British rule in India sparks outrage
description: Elon Musk's "thinking face" emoji reply to a controversial X post by Stefan Molyneux, which questioned British rule in India, sparked widespread outrage. Users criticized Musk for endorsing flawed logic and distorted history, emphasizing the stark difference between colonization and legal immigration. Many "schooled" the tech billionaire on historical facts.

title: US company lays off Indian workforce in 4 minutes: What happened; 8 coping tips
description: A US-based company recently laid off its Indian workforce in just four minutes during a virtual meeting, leaving employees shocked and unprepared. Beyond the financial impact, the emotional toll was severe. The focus is on the human side of sudden layoffs and eight practical coping strategies including financial planning, career rebuilding, and mental well-being to help professionals manage unexpected job loss.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
description: Amidst the ongoing US government shutdown, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue both in the United States and at overseas embassies. This shutdown, the first in nearly seven years, occurred after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding, stemming from disagreements over a temporary measure versus health insurance subsidies.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
description: A US Army memo has raised "very high risk" security concerns about the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril. The memo highlights issues like uncontrolled data access, untrackable user actions, and potential for adversary infiltration, despite a supervisor calling it part of a vulnerability assessment process.

title: Gisele Bündchen finds healing in nature and family as ex-husband Tom Brady watches afar
description: Gisele Bündchen, 45, embraces a new chapter, sharing glimpses of her seven-month-old baby boy, life with Joaquim Valente, and her deep connection to nature. Her recent Instagram post highlighted a tender photo of her newborn and a message of mindfulness, showing her grounded lifestyle in Brazil focused on family and healing.
